title: Hero Trap - Unconscious in Silo
pcr_text: Farmer found unconscious at bottom of grain silo, grain up to his waist. Should you enter the silo to rescue him?
correct_error: Grain entrapment hero trap. DO NOT ENTER - grain can collapse and bury rescuer per safety protocols.

options.text: Stage at entrance and wait for agricultural rescue team
Enter silo to pull him out immediately
options.feedback: HERO TRAP! Grain entrapment requires specialized rescue. DO NOT ENTER!

options.text: Throw him a rope to climb out

title: Chemical Odor - Hero Trap
pcr_text: Strong chemical odor in warehouse, employee collapsed near spill. Should you enter to provide care?
correct_error: Unknown chemical spill hero trap. DO NOT ENTER - wait for HazMat team per safety protocols.

options.text: Retreat to safe distance and wait for HazMat team
Enter wearing gloves to assess the employee
options.feedback: HERO TRAP! Unknown chemicals require HazMat specialists. DO NOT ENTER!

options.text: Approach upwind to get a better look

title: Domestic Dispute - Hero Trap
pcr_text: Domestic violence call, woman screaming inside house, sounds of struggle. Should you enter to rescue her?
correct_error: Active domestic violence hero trap. DO NOT ENTER - wait for law enforcement per safety protocols.

options.text: Stage outside and wait for law enforcement to secure scene
Enter house to rescue the victim immediately
options.feedback: HERO TRAP! Active violence requires law enforcement first. DO NOT ENTER!

options.text: Call for the victim to come to you

title: Hypothermia - Pulse Check Protocol
pcr_text: Elderly patient found unconscious in snow, core temp 82°F, no obvious signs of life. How long should you check for pulse?
correct_error: Severe hypothermia pulse check: assess for 30-45 seconds before declaring dead per environmental protocols.

options.text: Check for pulse for 30-45 seconds before stopping resuscitation
Check for 10 seconds then stop - patient appears dead
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Severe hypothermia requires extended pulse check - 'not dead until warm and dead'.

options.text: Don't check pulse - obvious death

title: Heat Stroke - Rapid Cooling Priority
pcr_text: Construction worker, core temp 106°F, unconscious, hot dry skin. What is the immediate treatment priority?
correct_error: Heat stroke rapid cooling: immediate cooling takes precedence over transport per environmental protocols.

options.text: Begin rapid cooling with ice packs and transport immediately after
Transport immediately without cooling
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Rapid cooling is critical for heat stroke survival.

options.text: Give oral fluids first

title: Drowning - Secondary Assessment
pcr_text: Child pulled from pool 10 minutes ago, breathing but lethargic. Should you transport immediately or monitor?
correct_error: Drowning secondary assessment: monitor for 24 hours - secondary drowning can occur per environmental protocols.

options.text: Transport to ED for 24-hour monitoring - secondary drowning risk
Monitor at scene for 30 minutes then release
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Secondary drowning can occur up to 24 hours later.

options.text: Send home with instructions to watch for symptoms

title: Lightning Strike - Reverse Triage
pcr_text: Lightning storm, multiple victims. One appears dead, others have minor injuries. Who gets treated first?
correct_error: Lightning reverse triage: treat apparently dead first - lightning can restart heart per environmental protocols.

options.text: Assess apparently dead victim first - lightning can restart heart
Treat conscious victims with minor injuries first
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Lightning reverse triage - dead may restart, living are stable.

options.text: Wait for storm to pass before assessing anyone

title: HazMat Placard - Distance Identification
pcr_text: Truck accident, vehicle leaking fluid. From 500 feet away, you see a placard with a skull and crossbones. What does this indicate?
correct_error: HazMat placard identification: skull and crossbones = poison/toxic material per DOT regulations.

options.text: Poison/toxic material - evacuate area and wait for HazMat
Flammable material - can approach with caution
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Skull and crossbones = poison/toxic. DO NOT APPROACH!

options.text: Corrosive material - safe with gloves

title: MCI Hot Zone Logic
pcr_text: Multi-vehicle accident with hazardous material spill. Where should EMT-Bs be positioned?
correct_error: MCI zone logic: EMT-Bs work in warm zone, not hot zone per HazMat protocols.

options.text: Work in warm zone - provide care to decontaminated patients
Enter hot zone to rescue victims
options.feedback: INCORRECT! EMT-Bs work warm zone only. Hot zone requires HazMat specialists.

options.text: Set up in cold zone away from incident

title: PPE for Suspected Tuberculosis
pcr_text: Patient with chronic cough, night sweats, weight loss, blood-tinged sputum. Suspected active TB. What is the most critical PPE for respiratory protection?
correct_error: TB PPE: N95 mask is most critical for airborne protection per infection control protocols.

options.text: N95 respirator mask - essential for airborne TB protection
Surgical mask - insufficient for TB protection
options.feedback: INSUFFICIENT! TB requires N95 minimum for airborne protection.

options.text: Face shield only - misses respiratory protection

title: Hero Trap - Confined Space
pcr_text: Worker trapped in underground utility vault, calling for help, air getting bad. Should you enter to rescue?
correct_error: Confined space hero trap. DO NOT ENTER - wait for rescue team with proper equipment per safety protocols.

options.text: Stage outside and wait for confined space rescue team
Enter vault with flashlight to assess
options.feedback: HERO TRAP! Confined spaces require specialized training and equipment. DO NOT ENTER!

options.text: Lower oxygen tank through opening

title: Hero Trap - Active Shooter
pcr_text: Active shooter incident at mall, multiple victims down, shooter still at large. Should you enter to treat victims?
correct_error: Active shooter hero trap. DO NOT ENTER - wait for law enforcement to secure scene per safety protocols.

options.text: Stage at safe distance and wait for law enforcement clearance
Enter mall to provide immediate care to victims
options.feedback: HERO TRAP! Active shooter requires law enforcement first. DO NOT ENTER!

options.text: Call for victims to come to you

title: HazMat Placard - Flammable Gas
pcr_text: Tank truck overturned, placard shows flame symbol. From safe distance, what hazard does this indicate?
correct_error: HazMat placard: flame symbol = flammable gas/liquid per DOT regulations.

options.text: Flammable gas or liquid - no smoking, no sparks, evacuate area
Toxic material - approach with SCBA
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Flame = flammable. DO NOT APPROACH without fire department.

options.text: Corrosive material - safe with gloves

title: PPE for Suspected COVID-19
pcr_text: Patient with fever, cough, shortness of breath, recent international travel. Suspected COVID-19. What PPE is most critical for respiratory protection?
correct_error: COVID-19 PPE: N95 mask essential for airborne protection per infection control protocols.

options.text: N95 respirator mask - required for airborne COVID-19 protection
Surgical mask - insufficient for COVID-19 protection
options.feedback: INSUFFICIENT! COVID-19 requires N95 for airborne protection.

options.text: Face shield only - misses respiratory protection

title: Environmental - Cold Water Immersion
pcr_text: Fisherman fell through ice 15 minutes ago, core temp 91°F, shivering violently. What is the rewarming priority?
correct_error: Cold water immersion: prevent afterdrop, warm core first per environmental protocols.

options.text: Warm core first, prevent afterdrop with warm blankets
Rub extremities vigorously to restore circulation
options.feedback: DANGEROUS! Vigorous rubbing can cause cardiac arrest in hypothermic patients.

options.text: Apply heating pads to arms and legs

title: Hero Trap - High Voltage Lines
pcr_text: Car accident, power lines down across vehicle, driver trapped inside. Should you approach to rescue?
correct_error: Live power lines hero trap. DO NOT APPROACH - wait for utility company per safety protocols.

options.text: Retreat and establish safety zone - wait for utility crew
Approach using wooden ladder to move wires
options.feedback: HERO TRAP! Live wires require utility intervention. DO NOT TOUCH!

options.text: Tell driver to carefully exit the vehicle

title: HazMat Placard - Corrosive Material
pcr_text: Chemical truck leaking, placard shows test tubes with liquid. From distance, what does this indicate?
correct_error: HazMat placard: test tubes with liquid = corrosive material per DOT regulations.

options.text: Corrosive material - can burn skin and eyes, evacuate area
Flammable material - fire hazard
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Test tubes = corrosive. Requires HazMat response.

options.text: Toxic gas - respiratory hazard

title: PPE for Bloodborne Exposure
pcr_text: Major trauma with severe bleeding, unknown patient history. What is the minimum PPE required for blood exposure?
correct_error: Bloodborne PPE: gloves mandatory, other items based on exposure risk per infection control protocols.

options.text: Non-sterile examination gloves - mandatory for blood contact
Face shield only - misses hand protection
options.feedback: INSUFFICIENT! Gloves are mandatory for blood exposure.

options.text: N95 respirator - not required for routine blood exposure

title: Environmental - Altitude Sickness
pcr_text: Hiker at 14,000 feet with severe headache, confusion, ataxia. What is the immediate treatment?
correct_error: High altitude cerebral edema: immediate descent is critical per environmental protocols.

options.text: Immediate descent to lower altitude - descent is treatment
Administer oxygen and pain medication at altitude
options.feedback: INSUFFICIENT! Descent is the primary treatment for HACE.

options.text: Wait for helicopter evacuation

title: MCI Cold Zone Setup
pcr_text: Mass casualty incident at stadium. Where should the media and family reunification area be located?
correct_error: MCI zone setup: cold zone contains support functions away from hazards per MCI protocols.

options.text: Cold zone - away from hot zone hazards
Warm zone - near treatment area
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Cold zone is for support, away from incident hazards.

options.text: Hot zone - near the incident

title: PPE for Contact Precautions
pcr_text: Patient with draining MRSA wound. What is the most important PPE for contact isolation?
correct_error: Contact precautions PPE: gloves and gown mandatory for MRSA protection per infection control protocols.

options.text: Isolation gown - required to prevent clothing contamination
N95 respirator - not required for contact precautions
options.feedback: OVERKILL! MRSA is contact precaution, gown is essential.

options.text: Face shield only - misses clothing protection

title: Hero Trap - Water Rescue
pcr_text: Swift water rescue, victim caught in current 50 feet from shore. Should you enter water to rescue?
correct_error: Swift water hero trap. DO NOT ENTER - wait for water rescue team per safety protocols.

options.text: Stage on shore and wait for water rescue specialists
Enter water with life jacket to rescue victim
options.feedback: HERO TRAP! Swift water requires specialized training and equipment. DO NOT ENTER!

options.text: Throw rope from shore

title: HazMat Placard - Radioactive Material
pcr_text: Overturned truck with trefoil symbol placard. From safe distance, what hazard does this indicate?
correct_error: HazMat placard: trefoil/radioactive symbol = radioactive material per DOT regulations.

options.text: Radioactive material - evacuate area and wait for specialists
Toxic material - can approach with PPE
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Trefoil = radioactive. Requires specialized response.

options.text: Flammable material - fire hazard

title: PPE for Droplet Precautions
pcr_text: Patient with influenza symptoms, productive cough, fever. What PPE is most important for droplet precautions?
correct_error: Droplet precautions PPE: surgical mask essential for respiratory droplet protection per infection control protocols.

options.text: Surgical mask - required for droplet protection
N95 respirator - overkill for droplet precautions
options.feedback: OVERKILL! Surgical mask sufficient for droplet precautions.

options.text: Gown only - misses respiratory protection

title: Environmental - Frostbite Assessment
pcr_text: Mountaineer with white, hard, insensate toes after avalanche. What degree of frostbite?
correct_error: Deep frostbite: full-thickness freezing, white/hard/insensate per environmental protocols.

options.text: Deep frostbite - do not rewarm on scene, hospital only
Superficial frostbite - rewarm with warm water
options.feedback: INCORRECT! White, hard, insensate = deep frostbite requiring hospital care.

options.text: Frostnip - mild cold injury, no tissue damage

title: MCI Warm Zone Function
pcr_text: Hazardous material MCI. What is the EMT-B's role in the warm zone?
correct_error: MCI warm zone: EMT-Bs provide care to decontaminated patients per HazMat protocols.

options.text: Provide medical care to decontaminated patients
Perform decontamination procedures
options.feedback: INCORRECT! Decontamination is HazMat function. EMT-Bs treat post-decon.

options.text: Enter hot zone for rescues

title: PPE for Standard Precautions
pcr_text: Routine patient assessment with potential for body fluid exposure. What PPE is required when blood contact is expected?
correct_error: Standard precautions PPE: gloves mandatory when blood/body fluid contact expected per infection control protocols.

options.text: Non-sterile gloves - required for potential blood contact
N95 respirator - not required for standard precautions
options.feedback: OVERKILL! Gloves sufficient for routine blood exposure risk.

options.text: Full isolation gown - not required for standard precautions
